column4: I work with someone in new york doing software design and what not is there some form of online meeting software that does voice, whiteboard file transfer and stuff like that that works under ubuntu and windows?
we need to be able to have online meetings he only comes down to my end of the country once a year
gnomemeeting (now ekiga) supposedly supports that NetMeeting stuff
is there a windows client since netmeeting is depreciated ?
But is he using the -386 kernel?
if hes runnign x86 he is
I have a x86 and use the -generic kernel.
Unless he's on dapper. not edgy.
why wouldnt he be on dapper?
Either way, if he's on edgy and using the normal kenrel, he's using -generic.
